com.uiza.sdk.helpers

Interface ICameraHelper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Camera1Helper, Camera2Helper

    public interface ICameraHelper

        Set filter in position 0.
        Parameters:

               com.pedro.encoder.input.gl.render.filters.BaseFilterRender filterReader)
        Set filter in position 0.
        Parameters:
        filterReader - filter to set. You can modify parameters to filter after set it to stream.

      • isAAEnabled

        boolean isAAEnabled()
        Get Anti alias is enabled.
        Returns:
        true is enabled, false is disabled.

      • enableAA

        void enableAA(boolean aAEnabled)
        Enable or disable Anti aliasing (This method use FXAA).
        Parameters:
        aAEnabled - true is AA enabled, false is AA disabled. False by default.

      • getStreamWidth

        int getStreamWidth()
        get Stream Width

      • getStreamHeight

        int getStreamHeight()
        get Stream Height

      • enableAudio

        void enableAudio()
        Enable a muted microphone, can be called before, while and after broadcast.

      • disableAudio

        void disableAudio()
        Mute microphone, can be called before, while and after broadcast.

      • isAudioMuted

        boolean isAudioMuted()
        Get mute state of microphone.
        Returns:
        true if muted, false if enabled

      • prepareAudio

        boolean prepareAudio(@NonNull
                     AudioAttributes attrs)
        Call this method before use startBroadCast(String). If not you will do a broadcast without audio.
        Parameters:
        attrs - AudioAttributes
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a AAC encoder).

      • isVideoEnabled

        boolean isVideoEnabled()
        Get video camera state
        Returns:
        true if disabled, false if enabled

      • prepareVideo

        boolean prepareVideo(@NonNull
                     VideoAttributes attrs,
                     int rotation)
        Parameters:
        attrs - VideoAttributes
        rotation - could be 90, 180, 270 or 0 (Normally 0 if you are streaming in landscape or 90 if you are streaming in Portrait). This only affect to stream result. NOTE: Rotation with encoder is silence ignored in some devices.
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a H264 encoder).

      • getSupportedResolutions

        java.util.List<VideoSize> getSupportedResolutions()
        Returns:
        list of VideoSize

      • startBroadCast

        void startBroadCast(java.lang.String broadCastUrl)
        Need be called after prepareVideo(VideoAttributes, int) or/and prepareAudio(AudioAttributes).
        Parameters:
        broadCastUrl - of the broadcast like: rtmp://ip:port/application/stream_name

        RTMP: rtmp://192.168.1.1:1935/fmp4/live_stream_name startPreview(CameraHelper.Facing) to resolution seated in prepareVideo(VideoAttributes, int). If you never startPreview this method startPreview(CameraHelper.Facing) for you to resolution seated in prepareVideo(VideoAttributes, int).

      • stopBroadCast

        void stopBroadCast()
        Stop BroadCast started with startBroadCast(String)

      • isBroadCasting

        boolean isBroadCasting()
        Get broadcast state.
        Returns:
        true if broadcasting, false if not broadcasting.

      • switchCamera

        void switchCamera()
           throws UZCameraOpenException
        Switch camera used. Can be called on preview or while stream, ignored with preview off.
        Throws:
        UZCameraOpenException - If the other camera doesn't support same resolution.

      • startPreview

        void startPreview(com.pedro.encoder.input.video.CameraHelper.Facing cameraFacing)
        Start camera preview. Ignored, if stream or preview is started. resolution of preview 640x480
        Parameters:
        cameraFacing - front or back camera. Like: CameraHelper.Facing.BACK CameraHelper.Facing.FRONT

      • startPreview

        void startPreview(com.pedro.encoder.input.video.CameraHelper.Facing cameraFacing,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Start camera preview. Ignored, if stream or preview is started.
        Parameters:
        cameraFacing - front or back camera. Like: CameraHelper.Facing.BACK CameraHelper.Facing.FRONT
        width - of preview in px.
        height - of preview in px.

      • isFrontCamera

        boolean isFrontCamera()
        is Front Camera

      • isOnPreview

        boolean isOnPreview()
        check is on preview
        Returns:
        true if onpreview, false if not preview.

      • stopPreview

        void stopPreview()
        Stop camera preview. Ignored if streaming or already stopped. You need call it after

      • isRecording

        boolean isRecording()
        Get record state.
        Returns:
        true if recording, false if not recoding.

      • startRecord

        void startRecord(java.lang.String savePath)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Start record a MP4 video. Need be called while stream.
        Parameters:
        savePath - where file will be saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If you init it before start stream.

      • stopRecord

        void stopRecord()
        Stop record MP4 video started with @startRecord. If you don't call it file will be unreadable.

      • setVideoBitrateOnFly

        void setVideoBitrateOnFly(int bitrate)
        Set video bitrate of H264 in kb while stream.
        Parameters:
        bitrate - H264 in kb.

      • isLanternSupported

        boolean isLanternSupported()
        Check support Flashlight if use Camera1 always return false
        Returns:
        true if support, false if not support.

        Returns:

      • setZoom

        void setZoom(float level)
        Set zoomIn or zoomOut to camera. Use this method if you use a zoom slider.
        Parameters:
        level - Expected to be >= 1 and <= max zoom level
        See Also:
        Camera2Base.getMaxZoom()

      • setZoom

        void setZoom(android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Set zoomIn or zoomOut to camera.
        Parameters:
        event - motion event. Expected to get event.getPointerCount() > 1
